body.p:
Bushes store,, Laurel co. Ky May 22st 1865
To his Exlency Thos, E, Bramlet
Gov. of. the state of Kentucky

Sir your petitioner ^A. P. Tuttle^ was at the last Term of the Laurel circuit Court find, $600 for selling one half pt, of Brandy as was alledged in the indictment which was found, on the Evedence of one Wm Cook a worthless & strifling vagabond, your petitioner A. P. states, that he never sold said Cook. a drop of Brandy in his life or whisky Eather, & only stilled the fall that, Brag Retreated out of Ky. & his distilery was. by them torn up &. him almost Broken up they tuck Every thing he had & is a poore man with a large famley & it wood be a deed of charrity to his children to Remand Remit the find he is a sober & hard working man & to pay the find wood cause his famly to suffer, & he there fore begs mercy at your hands,

the under sign J. p for Laurel county states that the a above Named A. P. Tuttle this day made oath befor me that the above statesment wer true &. I in dorse them to be correct, this the 22st of May 1865

Laurel Cir Ct
vs
A. P. Tuttle
Refused
